meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'penny', referring to a unit of currency equal to one hundredth of a dollar.
meanings.sent1: I found a few penni on the street and used them to buy some candy.
meanings.sent2: She saved up all her penni in a jar to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the shiny penni were nuts and tried to bury them.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a handful of penni, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the penni jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'penny', referring to a small copper coin of the United Kingdom.
meanings.sent1: The old man collected rare penni from different countries.
meanings.sent2: She used the penni to pay for a ride on the carousel.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun left a trail of penni leading to his pot of gold.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a cascade of penni, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The penni gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
